# Document Template System\n\n## Overview\n\nThis directory contains a complete document template system based on the Rozanski & Woods methodology for creating consistent architectural documents and diagrams.\n\n<!-- \nNote: Mermaid Diagram Format Update\n- Old format: .mmd file references\n- New format: .md files with ```mermaid code blocks\n- Reason: GitHub native support, better readability and maintainability\n-->\n\n## Template Structure\n\n```\ndocs/templates/\n├── README.md                           # This file - Template usage guide\n├── viewpoint-template.md               # Viewpoint document template\n├── perspective-template.md             # Perspective document template\n├── metadata-standards.md               # Document metadata standard format\n├── diagram-metadata-standards.md       # Diagram metadata standard format\n└── examples/                           # Example files\n    ├── functional-viewpoint-example.md\n    ├── security-perspective-example.md\n    └── diagram-examples/\n        ├── system-overview.md  # Contains Mermaid code blocks\n        ├── domain-model.puml\n        └── concept-diagram.excalidraw\n```\n\n## Template Usage Guide\n\n### 1. Viewpoint Document Creation\n\n**Use Case**: When creating documents for the seven major architectural viewpoints\n\n**Steps**:\n1. Copy `viewpoint-template.md` to target location\n2. Update Front Matter metadata according to specific viewpoint\n3. Fill in content for each section\n4. Ensure all required fields are completed\n\n**Naming Convention**:\n- File path: `docs/viewpoints/{viewpoint}/README.md`\n- Specific files: `docs/viewpoints/{viewpoint}/{specific-topic}.md`\n\n**Example**:\n```bash\n# Create functional viewpoint document\ncp docs/templates/viewpoint-template.md docs/viewpoints/functional/domain-model.md\n\n# Edit metadata\n# Change viewpoint: \"[viewpoint]\" to viewpoint: \"functional\"\n# Update other related fields\n```\n\n### 2. Perspective Document Creation\n\n**Use Case**: When creating documents for the eight major architectural perspectives\n\n**Steps**:\n1. Copy `perspective-template.md` to target location\n2. Update Front Matter metadata according to specific perspective\n3. Fill in cross-viewpoint application sections\n4. Define quality attributes and metrics\n\n**Naming Convention**:\n- File path: `docs/perspectives/{perspective}/README.md`\n- Specific files: `docs/perspectives/{perspective}/{specific-topic}.md`\n\n**Example**:\n```bash\n# Create security perspective document\ncp docs/templates/perspective-template.md docs/perspectives/security/authentication.md\n\n# Edit metadata\n# Change perspective_type: \"[perspective]\" to perspective_type: \"security\"\n# Update applicable viewpoints and quality attributes\n```\n\n### 3. Diagram File Creation\n\n**Use Case**: When creating various types of architectural diagrams\n\n**Steps**:\n1. Choose appropriate metadata format based on diagram type\n2. Add Front Matter at the beginning of diagram file\n3. Set correct viewpoint and perspective associations\n4. Configure automatic generation and maintenance information\n\n**Supported Diagram Types**:\n- **Mermaid** (.md with ```mermaid blocks): Suitable for overview and flow diagrams, using GitHub native code block format\n- **PlantUML** (.puml): Suitable for detailed UML diagrams\n- **Excalidraw** (.excalidraw): Suitable for conceptual design and hand-drawn style\n\n## Metadata Standards\n\n### Required Field Checklist\n\n#### Viewpoint Documents\n- [ ] `title`: Clear document title\n- [ ] `viewpoint`: One of the seven viewpoints\n- [ ] `last_updated`: Last update date (YYYY-MM-DD)\n- [ ] `version`: Version number (semantic versioning)\n- [ ] `author`: Author or team\n\n#### Perspective Documents\n- [ ] `title`: Clear document title\n- [ ] `perspective_type`: One of the eight perspectives\n- [ ] `applicable_viewpoints`: Array of applicable viewpoints\n- [ ] `quality_attributes`: Related quality attributes\n- [ ] `last_updated`: Last update date\n- [ ] `version`: Version number\n- [ ] `author`: Author or team\n\n#### Diagram Files\n- [ ] `title`: Diagram title\n- [ ] `type`: Diagram type (mermaid|plantuml|excalidraw)\n- [ ] `format`: File format\n- [ ] `description`: Diagram description\n- [ ] `last_updated`: Last update date\n- [ ] `version`: Version number\n- [ ] `author`: Author or team\n\n### Quality Checks\n\nUse the following scripts to validate metadata completeness:\n\n```bash\n# Check metadata for all files\n./scripts/validate-metadata.sh\n\n# Check specific directory\n./scripts/validate-metadata.sh docs/viewpoints/\n\n# Generate metadata report\n./scripts/generate-metadata-report.sh\n```\n\n## Automation Tools\n\n### Document Generator\n\n```bash\n# Quickly create documents using templates\n./scripts/create-viewpoint-doc.sh functional domain-model\n./scripts/create-perspective-doc.sh security authentication\n./scripts/create-diagram.sh mermaid system-overview functional\n```\n\n### Metadata Updater\n\n```bash\n# Batch update metadata\n./scripts/update-metadata.sh --field last_updated --value $(date +%Y-%m-%d)\n\n# Validate relationships\n./scripts/validate-references.sh\n```\n\n### Translation Automation\n\n```bash\n# Trigger automatic translation\n./scripts/trigger-translation.sh docs/viewpoints/functional/domain-model.md\n\n# Check translation status\n./scripts/check-translation-status.sh\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### 1. Document Writing\n\n**Structured Writing**:\n- Use the section structure provided by templates\n- Maintain logical consistency between sections\n- Ensure content completeness and accuracy\n\n**Content Quality**:\n- Use clear, concise language\n- Provide specific examples and code\n- Include relevant diagrams and visualizations\n\n**Relationship Management**:\n- Set correct related document links\n- Maintain consistency between viewpoints\n- Ensure diagrams sync with document content\n\n### 2. Metadata Management\n\n**Consistency**:\n- Use standardized tags and classifications\n- Maintain consistent naming conventions\n- Regularly check and update metadata\n\n**Traceability**:\n- Record document change history\n- Maintain version control information\n- Set appropriate review processes\n\n**Automation**:\n- Use Git hooks to validate metadata\n- Set up CI/CD processes for automatic checks\n- Configure automatic translation and synchronization\n\n### 3. Diagram Management\n\n**Tool Selection**:\n- **Mermaid**: Direct GitHub display, suitable for overview diagrams\n- **PlantUML**: Powerful features, suitable for detailed UML diagrams\n- **Excalidraw**: Hand-drawn style, suitable for conceptual design\n\n**Version Control**:\n- Maintain both source files and generated images\n- Set up automatic generation processes\n- Record reasons for diagram changes\n\n**Quality Control**:\n- Regularly check diagram accuracy\n- Ensure diagrams meet accessibility standards\n- Optimize diagram loading performance\n\n## Maintenance and Updates\n\n### Regular Maintenance Tasks\n\n**Weekly**:\n- [ ] Check metadata completeness for new files\n- [ ] Validate relationships between documents\n- [ ] Update expired links and references\n\n**Monthly**:\n- [ ] Review document content accuracy\n- [ ] Update version numbers and dates\n- [ ] Check translation synchronization status\n\n**Quarterly**:\n- [ ] Evaluate template applicability\n- [ ] Update best practice guidelines\n- [ ] Optimize automation processes\n\n### Template Evolution\n\n**Version Control**:\n- Template changes require version number updates\n- Record change reasons and impact scope\n- Provide migration guides\n\n**Backward Compatibility**:\n- New template versions should be backward compatible\n- Provide automatic migration tools\n- Archive old template versions\n\n**Community Feedback**:\n- Collect user feedback\n- Regularly evaluate template effectiveness\n- Continuously improve template design\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\n### Common Issues\n\n**Q: Metadata validation fails**\nA: Check YAML syntax, ensure required fields are complete, validate date format\n\n**Q: Diagrams cannot be generated**\nA: Check diagram syntax, confirm tool version, validate file paths\n\n**Q: Translation not automatically triggered**\nA: Check Hook configuration, confirm file path matching, validate translation service status\n\n**Q: Document relationship errors**\nA: Use relative paths, check file existence, update paths after file moves\n\n### Support Resources\n\n- **Documentation**: [metadata-standards.md](metadata-standards.md)\n- **Examples**: [examples/](examples/)\n- **Tools**: ../scripts/\n- **Issue Reporting**: Use GitHub Issues\n\nThis template system ensures document consistency, maintainability, and automated processing capabilities, supporting the entire project's document restructuring requirements."
